sentence.cn: 你好，但我恐怕斯通先生直到午餐时间还要在开会。
sentence.en: Hello,  but I'm afraid Mr. Stone is in a meeting until lunchtime.
sentence.from: 2019年高考英语全国卷3 听力 原文

entry.def: If something happens until a particular time, it happens during the period before that time and stops at that time.

example.ex: Until 1982 he was senior lecturer in botany at Durham University.
example.tran: 1982年以前他一直是达勒姆大学生物系的高级讲师。

example.ex: ...consumers who have waited until after the Christmas holiday to do that holiday shopping.
example.tran: 等到过完圣诞节才进行节日采购的顾客

entry.def: You use until with a negative to emphasize the moment in time after which the rest of your statement becomes true, or the condition which would make it true.
entry.tran: （与否定词连用）直到…之前，直到…为止，除非

example.ex: The traffic laws don't take effect until the end of the year...
example.tran: 交通法要到年底才生效。

example.ex: It was not until 1911 that the first of the vitamins was identified.
example.tran: 直到1911年才发现了第一种维生素。

Sentence.sentence: Historically, scientists have objected to sharing for many reasons: it is a lot of work; until recently, good databases did not exist; grant funders were not pushing for sharing; it has been difficult to agree on standards for formatting data; and there is no agreed way to assign credit for data.
